email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your recent inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for the laycan 15-20 October. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate is a bit higher than expected. Could you consider something in the mid-40s? Also, could you confirm the vessel details (DWT, LOA) and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. The MV Ocean Star has a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 250 meters. Regarding the freight rate, I can offer $48.75 per metric ton, which is competitive given the current market. Demurrage is set at $20,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised rate. We’re almost there—could you do $47.50? Also, can we confirm the laytime window is 72 hours? Let’s finalize this soon. Best, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I can agree to $47.75 per metric ton as a final offer. The laytime is confirmed at 72 hours, and the laycan remains 15-20 October. Let me know if we can proceed, and I’ll draft the charter party agreement. Best regards, Sarah.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $47.75 works for us. Please proceed with drafting the agreement, and send it over for review. Thanks for your flexibility. Cheers, John.
